p: REPuter-based analysis of repetitive sequences, such as forward and reverse repeats, yielded 39–55 repeats ( Figure 5A). In the three Arnebia cp genomes, they were located in the intragenic spacer (IGS) region, while in L. erythrorhizon they were particularly abundant in exons. MISA software ( Beier et al., 2017) identified a total of 420–439 SSRs ( Figure 5B), mostly in the LSC and particularly within the IGS region. The pentanucleotide motif was the most abundant in all accessions, followed by hexanucleotide motif repeats ( Figure 5C). Tandem repeats finder ( Benson, 1999) located most tandem repeats in the LSC ( Figure 5D). They were generally 31–50 bp long and only 2–5 tandem repeats >71 bp in length were identified in all four accessions.
